snippet: The foreign minister of Burkina Faso said a warlord in northern Mali must abandon his ties to Al Qaeda for negotiations to take place.
abstract: Djibril Bassole, foreign minister of Burkina Faso, meets with Iyad ag Ghali, leading warlord of Islamist Ansar Dine movement in northern Mali; region has been virtually closed to outsiders since its seizure from the faltering Malian Army by Islamist forces with ties to Al Qaeda; meeting is a rare diplomatic opportunity to attempt to avert a war that Western officials say is now nearly inevitable.
lead_paragraph: The foreign minister of Burkina Faso said a warlord in northern Mali must abandon his ties to Al Qaeda for negotiations to take place.
